articles.headline: As Hurricane Florence Threatens the Carolinas, 1 Million Ordered to Evacuate
articles.snippet: The Southeast is bracing for a major Category 4 storm later this week, with a one-two punch of both wind and storm surge and major inland flooding.
articles.abstract: The Southeast is bracing for a major Category 4 storm later this week, with a one-two punch of both wind and storm surge and major inland flooding.
articles.lead_paragraph: For the latest updates, read our Hurricane Florence live briefing here.

articles.headline: Les Moonves Put CBS on Top. Then It All Came Crashing Down.
articles.snippet: Mr. Moonves made his name as a programmer of shows with clear-cut villains and heroes. On Sunday, after more allegations of sexual misconduct, his career was in free fall.
articles.abstract: Mr. Moonves made his name as a programmer of shows with clear-cut villains and heroes. On Sunday, after more allegations of sexual misconduct, his career was in free fall.
articles.lead_paragraph: Leslie Moonves had a strong idea of what a network television program should be. He liked his sitcoms broad, with larger-than-life characters and big laughs. The dramas he selected featured protagonists who scored a win before the credits rolled.

articles.headline: Between Trump and Brussels, Trade Talks Face Myriad Challenges
articles.snippet: Senior trade officials met in Brussels to discuss eliminating tariffs. Despite attempts to project optimism, chances of failure were high.
articles.abstract: Senior trade officials met in Brussels to discuss eliminating tariffs. Despite attempts to project optimism, chances of failure were high.
articles.lead_paragraph: BRUSSELS — When it comes to trade negotiations, there is Trump speed, and then there is Brussels speed. Reconciling the two will be more laborious and hazardous than expected, exposing the world’s biggest trade partnership to further turmoil in the months ahead.
articles.byline: By Milan Schreuer and Jack Ewing

articles.headline: U.S. Weighs Sanctions Against Chinese Officials Over Muslim Detention Camps
articles.snippet: The economic penalties would be one of the first times the Trump administration has taken action against China on human rights violations.
articles.abstract: The economic penalties would be one of the first times the Trump administration has taken action against China on human rights violations.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Trump administration is considering sanctions against Chinese senior officials and companies to punish Beijing’s detention of hundreds of thousands of ethnic Uighurs and other minority Muslims in large internment camps, according to current and former American officials.

articles.headline: From Trump to Trade, the Financial Crisis Still Resonates 10 Years Later
articles.snippet: The resentment caused by the 2008 financial crisis set off a populist backlash that fomented distrust of expertise and political division, which could have worrying consequences.
articles.abstract: The resentment caused by the 2008 financial crisis set off a populist backlash that fomented distrust of expertise and political division, which could have worrying consequences.
articles.lead_paragraph: This week is the 10th anniversary of the inflection point of the financial crisis: the collapse of Lehman Brothers, the biggest bankruptcy in history. To some, it feels like a long time ago.

articles.headline: Nazi Collaborator or National Hero? A Test for Lithuania
articles.snippet: Jonas Noreika has been honored as a martyr since his execution by the Soviet secret police in 1947. But he now stands accused by his own granddaughter of helping the Nazis kill Jews.
articles.abstract: Jonas Noreika has been honored as a martyr since his execution by the Soviet secret police in 1947. But he now stands accused by his own granddaughter of helping the Nazis kill Jews.
articles.lead_paragraph: SUKIONIAI, Lithuania — For the tiny village of Sukioniai in western Lithuania, the exploits of General Storm, a local anti-Communist hero executed by the Soviet secret police in 1947, have long been a source of pride. The village school is named after him, and his struggles against the Soviet Union are also honored with a memorial carved from stone next to the farm where he was born.

articles.headline: A Top Goldman Banker Raised Ethics Concerns. Then He Was Gone.
articles.snippet: A senior banker called Goldman Sachs’s whistle-blower hotline, a rare dissent by a partner at the firm. His superiors, including the next chief executive, told him to relax.
articles.abstract: A senior banker called Goldman Sachs’s whistle-blower hotline, a rare dissent by a partner at the firm. His superiors, including the next chief executive, told him to relax.
articles.lead_paragraph: By the tight-lipped standards of Goldman Sachs, the phone call from one of the firm’s most senior investment bankers was explosive.
articles.byline: By Emily Flitter, Kate Kelly and David Enrich

articles.headline: Fight to Retake Last ISIS Territory Begins
articles.snippet: American-backed forces moved against the last slice of the Islamic State caliphate in the Middle East. But even stripped of its land holdings, the group remains a potent threat.
articles.abstract: American-backed forces moved against the last slice of the Islamic State caliphate in the Middle East. But even stripped of its land holdings, the group remains a potent threat.
articles.lead_paragraph: The last vestige of the Islamic State’s caliphate that straddled Syria and Iraq is under attack.
